Package io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.dataframe

Class MsdxSparkDataframe.Factory

java.lang.Object
io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.dataframe.MsdxSparkDataframe.Factory
All Implemented Interfaces:
MsdxDataframe.Factory
Enclosing class:
MsdxSparkDataframe
public static class MsdxSparkDataframe.Factory
extends java.lang.Object
implements MsdxDataframe.Factory
The Dataframe Factory provides public methods for creating dataframes and executing queries. The Factory also enables registering SQL user-defined functions with the database engine at implements the Dataframe.
Author:
Dr. Jeremy A. Bloom (jeremyblmca@gmail.com) Â©2019 Jeremy A. Bloom

    • schemaToSpark

      protected org.apache.spark.sql.types.StructType schemaToSpark​(MsdxContainer<java.lang.Class<?>> schema)
      Creates a Spark StructType from a MOSDEX schema. Maps Java classes to their equivalent Spark data types. Note that only Spark data types String, Integer, and Double are supported.
      Parameters:
      schema -
      Returns:
      an Apache Spark representation of the schema
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Java class is not supported in Spark

    • create

      public MsdxDataframe create​(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.stream.Stream<MsdxContainer<java.lang.Object>> records, MsdxContainer<java.lang.Class<?>> schema)
      Creates a new Dataframe using Spark from a Java stream. Note, this method requires creating an intermediate Java list in memory; it would be preferable to create the Dataframe directly from the stream, but Spark does not currently support that operation.
      Specified by:
      create in interface MsdxDataframe.Factory
      Returns:
      a new Dataframe

    • registerStringIDFunction

      public void registerStringIDFunction​(int numberOfKeyFields)
      Description copied from interface: MsdxDataframe.Factory
      Creates set of functions IDn that make a row or column Id string of the form "tableName_key", and registers it with the Dataframe Factory for use in queries as an SQL user-defined function. The functions created replace the calls to "CONCAT('tableName', '_', key)" in MOSDEX queries. Note, n, the number of keys specifies the corresponding function to be called (currently it is restricted to between 2 and 5). This method would be used in the MsdxDataframe.Factory. Notice that the database-specific classes that implement the actual SQL calls are not exposed.
      Specified by:
      registerStringIDFunction in interface MsdxDataframe.Factory
      Parameters:
      numberOfKeyFields - = n creates ID2,..., IDn

    • registerIntegerIDFunction

      public void registerIntegerIDFunction​(int numberOfKeyFields)
      Currently unsupported.
      Specified by:
      registerIntegerIDFunction in interface MsdxDataframe.Factory

    • registerFunctionCall

      public void registerFunctionCall​(java.lang.String functionName)
      Description copied from interface: MsdxDataframe.Factory
      Creates a function call string of the form "functionName(arguments)", and registers it with the Dataframe Factory for use in queries as an SQL user-defined function. The arguments string has the form "tableName_key", and would be constructed by calling one of the IDn functions. The functions created replace the strings "'functionName(Column or Row)'" in MOSDEX queries.

      This method would be used in the MsdxSolverModelingFactory.initializeFunctionTable method, called for each function defined there (new functions added by a user, as discussed there, also need to be registered with this method). Note that this function does not actually get any data; it merely creates a call string that is used by the MsdxModel.createSolutionObjects method to capture data from the solver.

      Notice also that the database-specific class that implements the actual SQL call is not exposed.

      Note, nothing in this method restricts it registering only solver function calls, so it can also include other user-defined SQL functions, if needed. However, it cannot specify the actual function to call nor pass it an argument; those have to be specified in the implementation of this method.

      Specified by:
      registerFunctionCall in interface MsdxDataframe.Factory

    • registerIntegerInfinity

      public void registerIntegerInfinity()
      Description copied from interface: MsdxDataframe.Factory
      Creates a function I_INFINTY(sign) that returns an integer representing an infinite value, and registers it with the Dataframe Factory for use in queries as an SQL user-defined function. If the sign parameter is either empty or plus, the return value is the Integer.MAX_VALUE; if it is "-", the return value is the Integer.MIN_VALUE.
      Specified by:
      registerIntegerInfinity in interface MsdxDataframe.Factory

    • registerDoubleInfinity

      public void registerDoubleInfinity()
      Description copied from interface: MsdxDataframe.Factory
      Creates a function INFINITY(sign) that returns a double representing an infinite value, and registers it with the Dataframe Factory for use in queries as an SQL user-defined function. If the sign parameter is either empty or plus, the return value is the Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY; if it is "-", the return value is the Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.
      Specified by:
      registerDoubleInfinity in interface MsdxDataframe.Factory
